story:
Inconsistencies in our Video

Some of you may of noticed that our ultimate fundraising goal was $14,000 but it says $16,000 in our budget below. Also it is said that our Indiegogo goal is $3,000 but really is $1,500. First we apologize for any confusion this may of caused but all of these statements were true at the time of filming. There was a large gap between the time of filming and publishing this because of issues with how to accept the money through our nonprofit the Highlander Educational Foundation or HEF. All of those issues have since been resolved but in that time we received grants, gained additional expenses, and approved an official budget. Large changes like these are what caused the number differences and we hope this clears up any confusion you may have. 


What is FIRST Robotics?

FIRST is a program started in 1989 by founder Dean Kamen, inventor of things like the segway and the insulin pump. It started small but has now grown into a world wide event with over 400,000 students involved in over 38,700 teams. FIRST robotics is sold as the sport for the mind and Dean Kamen asks if kids look up to sports superstars why can't they look up to engineers and scientists? There are currently three divisions to FIRST robotics: FLL, FTC, and FRC. FLL stands for the First Lego League which is aimed towards students in grades 4th - 8th. Students are given a series of challenges at the beginning of a build season and are tasked with building a robot out of just Lego Mindstorms to complete the challenges presented to them. FTC stands for the First Tech Challenge which is similar to FLL but it uses a more advanced kit named Tetrix. FTC is aimed at students in the 7th - 12th grade. Students are given a game that they must play with their alliance members and like FLL must construct a robot to play that game. They are also given a certain amount of time to complete the robot. Lastly is FRC, what team 5107 is involved in, which stands for First Robotics Competition. This is very similar to FTC with three major differences: the materials allowed to use, cost of the robots, and the size of the robots. We are given 6 weeks starting on January 3rd 2015 to design and build a robot to play a game presented to us on that day. While this might still be as clear as mud to some here is a video taken at the 2014 world event in St Louis Missouri that should clear it up a bit, http://bit.ly/1oXCCyX. 


How did the team come about?

This has been copy and pasted from our team website strictly because we feel it is the best and brief summary of where the team has been and plans on going. 


Pre - Rookie Year

The idea for team 5107 The Neurotoxins was originated from our current leader, Brenden Geary. He was apart of the 2011 offseason (Logo Motion) at team 2493 Robokong. It was a 30min commute for him to every meeting and head mentor of Robokong, Richard Sisk, urged him to create a FRC team in Inland Empire. He recruited his friends Sean and Ryan Gosiaco as the first editions to the team and quickly added Connor Leonard, Trenton Koeper, Ryan Barnhart, Padrick Osborn, and Liam Austin. We had very little idea on what to do or how to start the team. With lots of help from Richard Sisk we got registered in TIMS and established Tim Geary and Richard Leonard as our mentors. Then it came to money, the haunting $6,000 looming over us that we needed to raise to participate in our first season. We applied for the NASA and Boeing grant as well as holding a BBQ fundraiser at our schools annual Blackwatch wrestling tournament. We did not get much money from the fundraiser but we were fortunate enough to receive the Boeing grant which gave us the money we needed to participate. We were a rookie team now, team 5107!


Rookie Year

On kick off day we went to a local kickoff event in Riverside, CA to watch the broadcast and pick up our first KOP (Kit of parts). We were beyond excited and scared of a possible 3 hour broadcast before we got to know this year's challenge. We were pleasantly surprised when it was not long, 15min, after the broadcast started that the 2014 game was revealed. Aerial Assist was considered the Rookies game because it could be played with a very simple robot. More information on what this years game was and what our final robot turned out to be can be found here http://www.team5107.com/robots.html#2014aa. The build season was very hectic and fun. The main issue we ran into was that we had no money to buy/make additional "robot parts". This caused nearly 100% of additional costs to be completely out of pocket. This was a huge issue that we all agreed needed to be fixed next year. Another issue we ran into was the lack of communication between the entire team. People would make decisions without consulting the group and the team suffered as a result. This was again something we wanted to change next year. Through all of that we were very proud of what we produced and even held second place at the Inland Empire Regional before our claw broke. We finished the event in 31st place and was awarded the Rookie Inspiration award. We had a great time and learned so much in our rookie year and looked forward to our second year as a team. 


Where is the money we donate going?

I have added a copy of our approved budget below so you can get an idea of the teams financial need. $16,000 is what the team will need in order to continue to grow and establish itself enough so when its founding members graduate this year the program continues on. We have applied to many grants and are very grateful to have received $5,000 from the Upland Unified School District. This will cover our registration fees for the season which is a huge step in the right direction. We have also received an $8,000 grant from Chaffey College, $1,000 grant from BNI, $500 grant from HEF. This is again a step not the destination we are still $1,500 short of our goal. We have set our goal here on indiegogo at $1,500, but just because our goal is there does not mean we can not surpass it. The real goal of this fundraiser is to make as much money for the team as possible. If you have any questions or concerns do not hesitate to email the team at contact@team5107.com and we will get back to you as quickly as we can. Thank you for any support past, present, or current.


Total Budget, FIRST 2015 Season: $16,000

$5,000 - Registration Fee

$3,000 - 2015 Robot (wire, motors, bolts, rivets, connectors, motor controllers, etc.)

$1,250 - Bridgeport (CNC conversion, additional tooling, fixturing, etc)

$250 - Raw Material (tubing, bar stock, sheet, etc (Stainless, Steel, and Aluminum))

$3,000 - Tools for new shop (band saw, hand tools, tables, etc)

$500 - Food (snacks and drinks)

$1,000 - Promotional (T-Shirts, business cards, SWAG, uniforms, etc)

$1,000 - Rainy Day (Emergency Fund)

$1,000 - Unallocated (Place as needed)

These rewards are pretty lame!

We would have to agree with this one but even though it might seem we have a massive budget but if you look back at our budget you will see every penny is spent. We want to compensate you for your donation because it is so appreciated but we don't have much to give. We love and care for every single donor and want to treat each and everyone in our own special way. If you feel that more is deserved for your donation please do not hesitate to contact us at contact@team5107.com.    

Contact Info

Brenden Geary - Team Lead

(909) - 702 - 3106 

brendengeary@gmail.com

story:
Help Us Reach Our $2,000 Stretch Goal...

We did it! HOSTELWORLD.com has generously donated $2,800 to help fund the entire original goal for our Tuk Tuk Taco Project, which has inspired us to try and reach a little bit further for a stretch goal of $2,000. The stretch goal will help to support our school's operational budget for the next 4 months while we get the mobile taco stand up and running. You can help us by continuing to share our Tuk Tuk Taco project in order for us to reach our $2,000 stretch goal!


What are we doing?

What does a shiny new TUK TUK have to do with access to education for rural children in Cambodia? Here's the low-down:

If this project reaches its funding goal, we will purchase a big tuk tuk. During the DAY the tuk tuk will provide free transport to 70 young Khmer kids who live too rurally to get to school. During the NIGHT the tuk tuk will transform into a roving TACO vendor - with 100% of profits raised from taco sales going directly back to Sala Monkey, that same NGO school that provides free, high quality education to kids from desperately poor families living rurally in Cambodia.

Still following? Practical, smart, effective and freaking delicious. Kids go to school, expats and tourists eat tacos and The Sala Monkey Primary School receives sustainable funding. Tick, tick, tick. All the good things.

**This is actually a traditional style tuk tuk. The taco tuk tuk will be a wagon style tuk tuk, accommodating more kids and more room for selling tacos!

We fully intend to smash the target

The funding goal is low and we think we will reach it, but ideally we will smash this target with all of the extra funding going to the school.  It costs $670 per month to operate the FREE school, so any extra funds will be directly used to fund education.  No admin costs, no exorbitant teacher salaries - every dollar will go directly into the education of the 70 plus kids at the school.

Who is Sala Monkey Primary School?

Hi! My name's Tracy and I'm the founder, director and chief monkey of the Sala Monkey Primary School here in Kep, Cambodia. We're a small non-profit village school currently educating 70+ of the most impoverished children in Kep; in just a few short years we've gone from teaching basic English conversation to now providing our youngest students with a full UK National and International Primary Curriculum.

Running a non-profit school in rural Cambodia takes funding and we've been fortunate enough to receive the support needed to get the school off the ground and keep it going for a year and a half now. Having donor support is fabulous, but insuring our long term success hinges on generating sustainable income from within. 


The Tuk Tuk

The idea for the "Taco Tuk Tuk" came about through our initial need to acquire transportation for our students. The acquisition of a tuk tuk (Cambodian taxi - motorbike/cart) will serve many important purposes: 1. Providing safe transportation to and from Sala Monkey for the children living at the ASPECA orphanage, who will now be able to receive a quality education with us. 2.Transportation for routine and medical emergency services for our students and their families 3. Picking up school supplies and transporting the children for local field trips.

Here's where our friends and partners at The Mad Monkey Hostels come in...

The team behind Mad Monkey Hostels, a for profit social enterprise in Cambodia wants to fund more not-for-profit social enterprise projects in Cambodia just like this one.

They have already committed $800.00 of the funds required to make this project happen from events and parties and they see Indiegogo.com as a great way of widening and sharing participation in a unique idea like this.

Pretty awesome indeed! They also presented us with a challenge...they challenged us to find a way of generating sustainable income with the use of the tuk tuk during the off-hours when the tuk tuk isn't in use. There's already an excess of tuk tuk drivers in Kep providing taxi services, so we figured a taxi service wouldn't be a practical means of generating sustainable income. After some thought, it occurred to us that a tuk tuk would be perfect for selling street food!  Raising awareness and funding for the school. Currently, there are no (non-Khmer) street food options available to the tourists in Kep. In fact there's only a few options available even for Khmer food.

I'm a native Southern Californian who came to Cambodia as a teacher and ended up with her own amazing school.  I hail from a place where authentic Mexican food reigns supreme just across the border from Mexico. Logically, what could be a better option for street food here in Kep than offering the beloved street taco? Kep is located on the Gulf of Thailand and is home to the world renowned "Crab Market" of Cambodia.  The seafood is literally pulled fresh off the boats and the other fresh ingredients can be found just a short distance away at the local farmers market. Did I mention the homemade tortillas? Yep! Yummy homemade warm tortillas.

Tacos and Tuk Tuks?

After dark the Tuk Tuk will transform into a pimp my ride like Mexican - Khmer disco taco wagon selling delicious tacos to the good people of Cambodia and it's visitors.

100% of the revenue generated by sales of our delicious tacos will be used to fund The Sala Monkey School in Kep - a school that provides 100% free education to poor children in rural Cambodia and will of course provide employment for at least two local mums.

Let's say that again – 100% of the money we generate will go back into providing free quality education to poor kids in Cambodia who otherwise would not be able to afford to attend such a school.

It gets even better...The Mad Monkey has enlisted the help of the Monkey Army. What in the world is a Monkey Army you ask? It's a loyal following of friends and customers who partner with the Mad Monkey on social projects here in Cambodia.

The Monkey Army has started coming together for a global fundraising event on November 5th to support our Indiegogo campaign.


The Monkey Army Fundraising Events

The following events have been scheduled so far:

Cambodia

Phnom Penh

6th of November 2014 – Mad Monkey Phnom Penh – Come and join us from 7pm until 11:30 pm when we will link up each hostel and run concurrent parties in each.  Money from every drink sold will be donated to the cause and money on all Taco Sales on the night will also go to fund the project! Visit our website

6th of November – 2014 – Top Banana Phnom Penh Late Night Party - Details of this event to follow soon.

6th of November – 2014 – Love Bar After Party – $1 for every cocktail sold will be donated to this project! Come and join us for the after party from 12am until 4am!

Siem Reap

6th of November 2014 – Mad Monkey Siem Reap – Come and join us from 7pm until 11:30 pm when we will link up each hostel and run concurrent parties in each.  Money from every drink sold will be donated to the cause and money on all Taco Sales on the night will also go to fund the project! Visit our website

Kampot

6th of November 2014 – Mad Monkey Kampot  – Come and join us from 7pm until 11:30 pm when we will link up each hostel and run concurrent parties in each.  Money from every drink sold will be donated to the cause and money on all Taco Sales on the night will also go to fund the project! Visit our website

Australia

Sydney

8th November 2014  - Hanna & Amy are leaving Australia and heading for Cambodia, if you know them head over to Dump Street for an unforgettable party and help fund the Tuk Tuk Taco project. 

Netherlands

Amsterdam

8th November 2014 - Swave's Birthday/Halloween Party @ Cafe Life. The day after Swave returns from volunteering at Sala Monkey School - Cambodia!


A great time for a great cause! Looks like fun, huh? Host your own party! We have some really cool posters available to support you.

How Will The Funding Be Applied?

We are going to keep it simple, to outfit the tuk tuk as a roadside taco shop we need simple chairs, plastic tables and a food preparation area. By keeping it simple we have reduced the project costs significantly in the hope that this project will get funded.

Fixed Assets

Purchase A Tuk Tuk: $1500.00
Three stand up metal tables: $90.00
Half barrel BBQ and grill: $12.00
Chalk Board Menu: $90.00
Utensils $60.00
Signboard $120.00
Sauce pots and storage pans $70.00
Fold out tables x 4: $100.00
Plastic Stackable Chairs x 16: $200.00
Total : $2350.00

Operating Capital

Local salary 3 months $300.00
Starting stock food: $250.00
Starting stock beverage: $180.00
Online marketing budget 3 months $300.00
Total $1030.00

One off costs

License to operate $250.00
Fundraising Costs Indiegogo $145.20
Total $395.20

TOTAL FUNDRAISING REQUIREMENT

$3775.20.

Committed By Mad Monkey from events
$800.00

Campaign total for Indiegogo- $2975.00


What if you exceed your Indiegogo funding goal? 

Any additional money raised will go directly towards funding the operational costs of the school along with a portion designated for the funding of a new larger school building.



Other Ways You Can Help

So, you're low on funds this month but you love tacos and you want to give underprivileged kids a chance at a better life through education. It's easy to help! Just share, share, and share again...Indiegogo has some awesomely easy to use share buttons.

What if you exceed your Indiegogo funding goal? 
Any additional money raised will go directly towards funding the operational costs of the school along with a portion designated for the funding of a new larger school building. 



  Other Ways You Can HelpSo, you're low on funds this month but you love tacos and you want to give underprivileged kids a chance at a better life through education. It's easy to help! Just share, share, and share again...Indiegogo has some awesomely easy to use share buttons.

story:
Short Summary

I am a public school teacher in NJ and I created this nonprofit organization in order to fund a mentoring group in our school. The Invictus Club will support and mentor 8th grade girls and encourage them to choose education as their path to success. The funds for this particular campaign will go toward throwing a "Welcome Back to School" dinner party for the girls and their parents. Parent involvement is the key to our success as educators. If we can encourage the parents to come to our party, we will start the school year off the right way for the kids who need the most support.

What We Need

We are trying to raise money to buy the following:

  • dinner, drinks, desserts for as many as 30 people
  • a backpack full of school supplies for each student and any siblings
  • an Invictus t-shirt or sweatshirt for each of the students
  • a small gift bag for each of the parents who attends our party
If we can't raise the necessary funds to throw a full party, we will still try to have a get-together in the library and maybe just buy some cookies and desserts for the kids.

    The Impact

    This project is important because we have an exploding population of partially-proficient, economically disadvantaged kids. They are falling behind in school and we need to provide more social and emotional support than is available during a typical school day. If we can make school feel like a safe-haven and a place where parents are encouraged to participate, we may be able to reach our most vulnerable population of girls. Someday, they will go on to become mentors themselves so let's get this started!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

      • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
      • Check out our website at www.invictusclub.org

      Thank you. On behalf of the kids who can't thank you themselves, I thank you.

story:
OUR WORK:


Individual commitment to a group effort - that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.


     


Faith Alive Foundation (FAF) has transformed the community of Hwol Yarje by building a school and implementing an elementary-level curriculum.  Before Faith Alive's involvement, the majority of Hwol Yarje's youth were uneducated and could not even speak English—Nigeria's national language.  

Due to FAF and its supporters, hundreds of children have learned the basics in Science, English and Math—some of which have received scholarships to move onto higher education.  The community is now thriving.

More kids than ever are entering the school to become educated.  And we are raising funds to support this growth.

For only $60, one Nigerian child will receive the valuable education that is ending the cycle of poverty in that region.  Your support will bring peace, hope, and liberate the future of Nigeria.

Support education today and contribute to building a brighter future for Nigeria.


PERKS:


For it is in giving that we receive.



For your contribution, we’re giving you a piece of Nigeria.  We’re offering a unique blend of Nigerian artwork, jewelry and garments as incentives for this campaign.  We have several unique and colorful pieces of original art from Nigerian artist and pastor, John Afolayan; stunning images from LA-based photographer, Sasha Leahovcenco, which were captured during his recent trip to Hwol Yarje.  Along with traditional makeup bags for women and bracelets for all — each crafted by Faith Alive Foundation members.  All of these incentives are unique to the country of Nigeria and will make perfect Christmas gifts!


Donations within the following tiered structure will gift you an authentic Nigerian oil tapestry from John Afolayan, a world renowned Nigerian artist.


$1,000 Donation = Large (20.5'' x 25'') Oil Painting

$500 Donation = Medium (16'' x 21.5'') Oil Painting

$250 Donation = Small (20'' x 14'') Oil Painting

Visit HERE to view ALL of your choices.


Your generous donation today is so important.  And with only two weeks left in our campaign, we humbly ask for your support in reaching our targeted goal.  Together we can provide education, liberate the Nigerian youth and end the cycle of global poverty.

  

MILESTONES:


For the protection of wisdom is like the protection of goods, and the advantage of knowledge is that wisdom preserves the life of him who has it.



     We have built seven small tin classrooms in Hwol Yarje village.  Desks accommodate three students, and we have purchased new desks, uniforms, and supplies, as well as helped pay student fees. But there is still much more work to be done. That is why Faith Alive USA needs to raise $25,000 USD to cover the costs of a variety of projects, including: 

  • 3 new classrooms and 1 Staff room: $22,000;
  • 45 desks and chairs for students: $2,000;
  • 3 blackboards, 3 tables and chairs: $650;
  • Student Supplies: $350

THE IMPACT:


As each has received a gift, use it to serve one another, as good stewards of varied grace.



     By allocating $25,000 to the projects outlined above, we can ensure every Howl Yarje child has access to a quality primary school education. Education creates opportunity, fosters productivity, and implements sustainability. The school in Hwol Yarje inspires Nigerian children and parents alike to learn, to grow, and to succeed. By investing our resources into this school, we truly change these people’s lives.

You too can change lives by:

·  Offering financial support

·  Praying for Nigeria

·  Sharing information with your family and friends 

·  Joining our online community (Facebook Page and Twitter)

·  Volunteering with our team (Contact Us)

     In 2008, Faith Alive USA and a team of volunteers visited the Faith Alive Foundation Nigerian (FAFN) Hospital in Jos, returning home not only awed by the inspirational patients, staff, and volunteers, but also overwhelmed by the incredible need. They founded Faith Alive USA (FAUSA), securing FAUSA’s 501(c)3 tax-exempt status from the Internal Revenue Service in December 2013. Then in 2014, the FAUSA board of directors prepared the Call to Action to assure that Faith Alive Foundation Nigeria would continue its work. We are all called to act. We can all change lives.

story:
Girls Leadership Ins. Website 

Who Am I? What's my story? 

My name is Mali Fenning and I am a teenage girl from Pennsylvania, who is aspiring to be a leader and change the world. Moreover, My mom is an educational leader in the arts, and my sister is a Junior in High School, who is planning on attending California Berkley for business and non-profits. I truly hope to follow in their footsteps as leaders. 

I am currently finishing my last year of Middle School, which I am extremely ecstatic about! Middle School has been an extremely tough time for me, ever sense I returned home from a life changing missions trip to India in 2011 (7th grade). India changed my life, and it caused me to examen every detail of my life as well. I wanted to be completely selfless, I wanted to give my life to God, I also grew beyond my friendships, but most of all I did not want to leave the house. Even though, I wanted to be the best person I could be; I focused on how much I regretted the person I was before, which made me go into an extremely depressive state. Also, it didn't help that when I expressed this to my friends at the time, they rejected me. Though after much trials and tribulation, I am a new person now, and I really am the person I wanted to be coming back from India. However, that experience still is a part of me, and I lost much confidence from it too. And, by attending GLI I will be stronger than I ever have been. Therefore, this won't just be a leadership journey, but a personal journey too.

       What Is The Girls Leadership Institute? 

        The Girls Leadership Institute was co-founded by Rachel Simmons. Rachel has written four books about adolescent females. The Girls Leadership Institute mission is to teach, "the practices of emotional intelligence, assertive self-expression and healthy relationships, giving girls the skills and confidence to live as leaders." Girls Leadership Institute is a program designed to awaken girls to a life of "authentic leadership". Furthermore, GLI offers workshops for women of all ages, and summer camp for girls from sixth to twelfth grade. At GLI summer camp, the camp holds art intensives, workshops, a personal project, and the community of all females. In addition, their programs are specifically about developing girls’ “internal” leadership skills, and empowering the strength in young women to become effective, passionate leaders. 

       What Is GLI Going To Do For Me And Why Do I Want To Go?

       By attending the Girls Leadership Institute I will gain many new experiences, relationships, and strong leadership skills. In addition, here are numerous amount of reasons why I want to attend GLI:

 To gain inner confidence that will help form me into an improved leader.

 New experience and to branch out from home.

 To help influence girls in my community.

 To help empower girls in other countries, like when I return to India for a missions trip.

 To gain new insights on life, leadership, and myself.

 To learn how to build stronger, healthier relationships. 

      What I Need And What You Get

       What I need is 2,900.00 dollars to pay for my full tuition for GLI summer camp, and in a pretty short amount time. I have received a partial scholarship, however, if I do not raise all of my tuition for the Girls Leadership Institute on "Indiegogo," than there is a possibility that I will not have the opportunity to attend GLI. In addition, 100% of your donations to my cause will be going to my tuition for Girls Leadership Institute summer camp. Furthermore, I can't stress enough on how every single dollar helps me get to Bryn Mawr (where GLI summer camp is being held). Also, if I were to raise more than my goal, the extra money will go to gas, paying for trips during GLI summer camp, supplies for camp, and any other expenses that will have to go into GLI summer camp. Now, what you get for donating to my cause depends on what amount of money you donate. For example, if you donate as little as $5.00, you will receive a virtual high-five! Woot! However, if you donate up to $1,000 or more you will receive all of the perks from, "The Reflective Award," and you'll also be receiving a copy of one of Rachel Simmons book, with a personal note from myself. In addition, with every perk you will receive a virtual high-five, and a sincere, personal thank you because by donating, you will have helped me in so many ways you cannot even imagine, and you will have changed my life. 

     Why Should You Send Me To GLI?

       I understand that there are so many causes, which you are willing to give to, and you want to know why you should give your hard earned money to me. Well, because I am a good investment. Why am I a good investment? Because, by attending the Girls Leadership Institute I will gain self confidence and leadership skills of a life time. By gaining these skills, I will be able to change the world around me, and one day the entire world. My generation has to be the change, and I can help start that change through my experience at GLI. Furthermore, by donating even just a dollar we can get a step closer to a better world.     

         No Money? No Problem!

         Of course by sending financial assistance you are helping immensely. However, you can also help by sharing my cause with everyone you know, or even people you don't know! I would appreciate so much if you would take the time to share this link with your friends, neighbors, aunts, uncles, grandparents, co-workers, boyfriends, girlfriends, even people on Twitter, Tumblr, and Facebook! It would also mean a lot if you kept me in your thoughts and prayers, while I am on this amazing leadership journey. 

I am extremely excited that I was given the opportunity to be a part of the Girls Leadership Institute, and by donating you can be a part of my amazing leadership journey.

Thank you so very much for contributing and have a beautiful, balanced, blessed day.


Mali Fenning

story:
Ready to join forces with Vivoman, Sha' Michael Manuel, Bro5, Genevieve Jackson, and The Riley Sisters to stop bullying once and for all? Then you are in the right place. Let us explain. Vivoman is a socially-conscious clothing company who encourages everyone to stand up for what they believe in. They have partnered with 17 year-old bullying victim Sha' Michael Manuel, Bro5 (an all brother band from New Jersey - Bruises), young Hollywood starlet, Genevieve Jackson (daughter of Randy Jackson - Jackson 5), and The Riley Sisters (a female R&B/electro-rock/pop supergroup).

These incredible voices have come together to put more awareness on bullying and help schools with their anti-bullying programs. Their goal is to get an anti-bullying wristband on every school age kid in America.


We all know bullying is a serious problem and thankfully there has been a media push to give it the attention it deserves. We want to keep the momentum going by creating even more awareness, especially among younger kids. If we can reach them through a simple wristband, we can affect social outcomes and actually empower young people.

You may not realize this, but 1 in 4 kids are bullied every day. Sadly, only 4% of fellow students or friends will intervene. Unbelievably, only 11% of adults intervene! Because of fear, 160,000 students will miss a school day to avoid a situation. We can do better.
Let's give kids a chance and put an end to the fear.



Awareness and education are the only ways to stop bullying. Vivoman wants to step up and we hope you will do the same. The US government has mandated every school have an anti-bullying curriculum in place this year. We want to help them and our plan involves sending each school a box of anti-bullying wristbands for every student in grades K-8. 


We know our goal is lofty, but it starts with a simple donation from you. Any amount helps, even one dollar. We are confident we can get an anti-bullying wristband on every child and take bullying awareness through the roof. Only through awareness can we reach our goal. Here is our goal breakdown:

First Tier Goal - $59,780

Distribute an anti-bullying wristband to 250,000 children (grades K-8). When our project is funded, we will purchase the wristbands and start the campaign in the Southeastern United States. Our team will be calling schools directly and shipping boxes of wristbands to them with additional anti-bullying promotional tools, such as t-shirts and dog tags. 

Second Tier Goal - $136,120

Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to 1 million children.

Third Tier Goal - $615,600

Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to 5 million children.

Fourth Tier Goal - $1,214,200

Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to 10 million children. 

Fifth Tier Goal - $2,407,400

Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to 20 million children. 

Sixth Tier Goal - $4,210,130

Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to all children in America (35.1 million kids - grades K-8). When our project reaches this goal, we will continue contacting schools and shipping wristbands until every elementary school has received them. We have a decidated team ready in the wings to begin implementation. Become a part of this amazing project! 

You might be wondering, "What's in it for me?" Well, quite a lot actually. Aside from great prizes and knowing you're helping stop bullying, you could even win an exclusive concert from Bro5! There are three ways to win*:  

1) Get your school involved. Start by telling everyone you know, maybe post a challenge on Facebook or Twitter, or make flyers with your school's permission. (And if you're not in school, you probably know someone who is and how cool would it be if you helped them get a concert?). Use the hash tags: #LiveStandingUp, #SupportAntiBullying, #Bro5, #Vivoman, #ComeToMySchool. One lucky school will win an exclusive concert for raising the most funds on this Indiegogo campaign. To make your school eligible, please note in the comment field when making your Indiegogo donation the name of your school, the city and state. We'll tally the results and announce the winner in January. 

2) How do you #LiveStandingUp? 
Post an Instagram video of what you stand for that makes the world a better place? Is it freedom of expression through the arts? Is it helping your community? Is it taking care of loved ones? Show us how you live to stand up and our celebrity band ambassadors will pick their favorite ones. Submit by tagging @vivoman, #LiveStandingUp. Five winners will receive the 10th grader perks!

3) Post your personal bullying story on Facebook or YouTube. One story will be chosen and that lucky person will win the Super Senior perk! Be brave. Your story could be just the encouragement another kids need. Be sure to tag @Vivoman. 

* Kids under 18 need parent's permission.

Here is our plan. Your donation will go towards:

- purchasing anti-bullying wristbands (up to 35 million of them!)

- packing/shipping wristbands to schools 

Our team will be donating staff time, logistical support, and additional promotional tools such as posters and dog tags, to make sure schools have an effective anti-bullying curriculum in place. 

Change starts with one person standing up for what they believe in. We ask you to stand up today and help this cause. We can get an anti-bullying wristband on every kid in America and create a united front against bullies everywhere. 

Let's get the word out, together. Please use the Indiegogo share tools and let as many of your friends and family know about our campaign. Chances are you know someone who is/was bullied. Perhaps, it is you. Take a stand and make a real difference. Always live standing up.

Thank you.

Any amount helps, even one dollar. We are confident we can get an anti-bullying wristband on every child and take bullying awareness through the roof. Only through awareness can we reach our goal. Here is our goal breakdown:First Tier Goal - $59,780Distribute an anti-bullying wristband to 250,000 children (grades K-8). When our project is funded, we will purchase the wristbands and start the campaign in the Southeastern United States. Our team will be calling schools directly and shipping boxes of wristbands to them with additional anti-bullying promotional tools, such as t-shirts and dog tags. Second Tier Goal - $136,120Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to 1 million children.Third Tier Goal - $615,600Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to 5 million children.Fourth Tier Goal - $1,214,200Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to 10 million children. Fifth Tier Goal - $2,407,400Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to 20 million children. Sixth Tier Goal - $4,210,130Distribute anti-bullying wristbands to all children in America (35.1 million kids - grades K-8). When our project reaches this goal, we will continue contacting schools and shipping wristbands until every elementary school has received them. We have a decidated team ready in the wings to begin implementation. Become a part of this amazing project! 
You might be wondering, "What's in it for me?" Well, quite a lot actually. Aside from great prizes and knowing you're helping stop bullying, you could even win an exclusive concert from Bro5! There are three ways to win*:  1) Get your school involved. Start by telling everyone you know, maybe post a challenge on Facebook or Twitter, or make flyers with your school's permission. (And if you're not in school, you probably know someone who is and how cool would it be if you helped them get a concert?). Use the hash tags: #LiveStandingUp, #SupportAntiBullying, #Bro5, #Vivoman, #ComeToMySchool. One lucky school will win an exclusive concert for raising the most funds on this Indiegogo campaign. To make your school eligible, please note in the comment field when making your Indiegogo donation the name of your school, the city and state. We'll tally the results and announce the winner in January. 2) How do you #LiveStandingUp? Post an Instagram video of what you stand for that makes the world a better place? Is it freedom of expression through the arts? Is it helping your community? Is it taking care of loved ones? Show us how you live to stand up and our celebrity band ambassadors will pick their favorite ones. Submit by tagging @vivoman, #LiveStandingUp. Five winners will receive the 10th grader perks!3) Post your personal bullying story on Facebook or YouTube. One story will be chosen and that lucky person will win the Super Senior perk! Be brave. Your story could be just the encouragement another kids need. Be sure to tag @Vivoman. * Kids under 18 need parent's permission.Here is our plan. Your donation will go towards:- purchasing anti-bullying wristbands (up to 35 million of them!)- packing/shipping wristbands to schools Our team will be donating staff time, logistical support, and additional promotional tools such as posters and dog tags, to make sure schools have an effective anti-bullying curriculum in place. Change starts with one person standing up for what they believe in. We ask you to stand up today and help this cause. We can get an anti-bullying wristband on every kid in America and create a united front against bullies everywhere. Let's get the word out, together. Please use the Indiegogo share tools and let as many of your friends and family know about our campaign. Chances are you know someone who is/was bullied. Perhaps, it is you. Take a stand and make a real difference. Always live standing up.Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ashley Hedgepath.  I'm a 21 year old undergraduate psychology major at Appalachian State University.  I've been working really hard with my professor this past year in studying human empathy and motivation.  

Our research focuses specifically on the idea of "empathetic anger", or feeling angry on BEHALF of someone else.  For example, if you feel angry FOR children who live in poverty, you may choose to get involved in the community to help eliminate it.

Contributors will be making our research more widely available to public knowledge.  I truly believe this is important information...  It not only paves the way for future research in emotion-motivated empathy, but it offers a new perspective on what motivates people to HELP.

This is a huge opportunity for me, and I really have my heart set on presenting the research that I've worked so hard on.  Any help will be GREATLY appreciated, and no cent will go unnoticed.  Thank you all so much for your consideration.

A Link To The Conference: http://www.researchslce.org/

 

Wish me luck!

-Ashley

story:
GO,PAUL. GO!


                                      TRAINING FOR THE BIG ADVENTURE


In 2016, I will be joining up with my friend, and cycling partner, Clint Valentine, for a 20,000 mile long bicycle journey, from The shores of the Arctic Ocean, to the shores of the Beagle channel.    http://goo.gl/maps/3zcNy. We will pass through 14 countries, traverse some of the harshest terrain,Passes over 15,000 feet, ride through grizzly bear habitats,and face swarms of malaria ridden mosquitos. Add a mix of freezing temperatures, extreme desert heat, rain, snow and plenty of mud, and you have the makings of a grand adventure.

                                                       

                                                     WHY? YOU ASK

  Along the way we will be gathering scientific samples, and data in cooperation with  http://www.adventureandscience.org/.  We will also be filming, and writing about our journey, with plans for a presentation upon our return. But, I am getting ahead of myself.

What I need to do is start training for this bicycle adventure, and I could use your help.


                                                 WHAT CAN YOU DO?

This will be a physically brutal adventure, and I will need all the prep time and training that I can get before Clint and I begin our journey. Clint has the advantage of youth,he is half my age, and can wait till a few weeks before we head out to begin training. I on the other hand, am looking at the calender, and clock,  hoping I have enough time.  This is where you come in.  I have never been a big fan of work outs. all rather boring.  I could use not only some financial help, but more importantly, a squad of cheerleaders and coaches to cheer me on. GO,PAUL. GO!

I have pitched my story to the owner of the local local gym, and she is willing to give me a great deal if I sign up for a two year membership.  How can I pass that up!  They will also provide a personal trainer for the first week, to help me get on track.


                                               WANT TO BE A COACH?



Have a workout plan that you like.  Tips on planking or running that you would like to share?  What about stretching and yoga.  I will welcome any advice and tips.  


      AN IDEA OF WHAT WE WILL BE FACING, AND WHAT I AM TRAINING FOR


                               RIDING THE SPINE. 20,000 MILES BY BICYCLE.



                                              

                                                    THIS WILL BE FUN




                       THE ATACAMA DESERT (but it's a dry heat)

 


                                                                                                                                                       

                      

                                                         MORE MUD

      

                                             GLAD I TRAINED FOR THIS!




                                             HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP


If you have made a contribution of any amount, I will be forever grateful, but if you could also spread the word, tell your friends, that would be fantastic.



               CAN PEOPLE STILL HELP IF YOU HAVE REACHED YOUR GOAL?

YES!!!  Any additional funds would be welcome. This is a two year project, and any extra funds will put to use for training.

story:
Dear valued customers,

I have my own personal life project started, which will not be possible without financial support.

Recently, both of my biological parents have died of cancer and the effects of chemotherapy. Because of the distance and the financial ability, I had little opportunity for them to be there.

Cancer is a really horrible disease that no one deserves!

I have therefore decided to sort my life and start a new medical school. I want to help other people be actively involved in the research. All that I could not afford for my parents.

Also, I want my 5 year old daughter to be proud of me can see me as a role model to want to help other people.

Unfortunately, I'm already 32 years old, which means in Germany to get any support handsome, even in the context of health insurance, there is no more perks. It is more than difficult to start with about a 30 degree.

I'm already working way, which leads unfortunately to have less time for my daughter. Unfortunately, this money is not enough to cover all costs. Currently I am trying desperately the cost of textbooks to finance. Without textbooks I will have it very hard.

I would be happy if there are people who want to help me realize this goal / dream.

Even now, I want to thank you from my heart! Ab imo pectore.

______________________________________________________________________

Liebe Interessenten,

ich habe mein ganz persönliches Lebensprojekt gestartet, was ohne finanzielle Unterstützung leider nicht realisierbar sein wird.

Vor kurzem sind meine beiden leiblichen Eltern an Krebs und den Auswirkungen der Chemotherapien verstorben. Aufgrund der Entfernung und der finanziellen Möglichkeiten, hatte ich kaum die Möglichkeit für sie da zu sein.

Krebs ist eine wirklich schreckliche Krankheit, die niemand verdient hat!

Ich habe daher beschlossen, mein Leben neu zu sortieren und ein Medizinstudium zu beginnen. Ich möchte anderen Menschen helfen, aktiv an der Forschung beteiligt sein. Alles das, was ich für meine Eltern nicht leisten konnte.

Auch möchte ich, dass meine 5 jährige Tochter stolz auf mich sein, mich als Vorbild sehen kann, anderen Menschen helfen zu wollen.

Leider bin ich bereits 32 Jahre alt, was in Deutschland bedeutet, keinerlei stattliche Hilfen zu bekommen, auch im Rahmen der Krankenversicherung gibt es keine Vergünstigungen mehr. Es ist mehr als nur schwer, mit über 30 ein Studium zu beginnen.

Ich arbeite bereits nebenbei, was leider dazu führt, weniger Zeit für meine Tochter zu haben. Leider reicht dieses Geld nicht, um alle Kosten decken zu können. Derzeit versuche ich dringend die Kosten der Lehrbücher zu finanzieren. Ohne Lehrbücher werde ich es sehr schwer haben.

Ich würde mich freuen, wenn es Menschen gibt, die mir helfen wollen, dieses Ziel/ Traum zu verwirklichen.

Schon jetzt, möchte ich mich aus tiefstem Herzen bedanken! Ab imo pectore.

_____________________________________________________________________

story:
BARC EDUCATION CENTRE

BARC rescues, rehabilitates and re-homes the Bali street dogs and animals in need from all over the island. But we believe prevention is better than cure and our time could be just as effective in an education room teaching the next generation the correct way to treat an animal. Love, care and nurture. 

BARC Education will be FUN! We want to engage the kids of Bali and inspire them to care for their fur-brothers and sisters like they would their siblings. We will be holding Movie Nights with fresh (healthy) popcorn featuring Doggy Movies. PLUS we will be performing Puppet Shows and important information all people should know about animals. 

At BARCS new Adoption and Information Centre we intend to set up a space dedicated to education! 

We plan to have weekly Doggy Movie Nights JUST for the village children. The Portable Projector can also be taken to other villages where we can set up temporary movie cinemas to showcase the films we as kids (and adults) love to watch! Imagine the delight on the kids faces when they see this special treat. Its moments like these that will resonate with them fur-ever.

Additionally we will have puppet shows (a traditional form of Balinese entertainment) and tell the children (and their parents) the Yudhisthira Story! A story from Hindu scriptures about a mans relationship with his dog who he was asked to abandon when he made it to heavens gates. When he said no, he was accepted and passed his final test showing humility for all beings!  Click here to read the full story.

We will also hold animal welfare seminars for the adults on animal health and welfare, puppy and dog training and so much more! 

What We Need & What You Get

It's a very simple set up with a few overhead costs to make it just right! We need to raise $3000 to cover the following

  • Portable Projector (so we can go to other locations)
  • Speakers
  • Bean Bags
  • Paint (for the screen wall)
  • Popcorn Machine (because you can't have a movie without pop-corn right?!)
  • Kids Doggy DVDs
  • Bilingual Education Banners to cover the walls

The Impact

To start changing the perception of animals and their treatment in Bali we need to focus our attention on the next generation. The generation that will grow up to love and care for the animals, and to speak up when they know an animal is not being treated or cared for properly. This kind of impact is PRICELESS! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please like this campaign on this page (below) and it will automatically be shared with your social network 
  • Tell your friends and family why you are supporting this cause
  • Sponsor a dog www.BARC4BaliDogs.org
  • Fundraise. Email fundraise@balidogrefuge.com for some ideas
  • Collect expired medicines from your local vet, hospital or chemist and have them sent to Bali. Email info@balidogrefuge.com for more information

*Images of children with dogs - Copyright www.thebalistreetdog.com

story:
Short Summary

I'm a climatologist and Professor who has made 20 expeditions to Greenland's ice. I represent an open science and journalism team uniquely qualified to measure and communicate the impact of wildfire and industrial black carbon "soot" on the darkening of Arctic snow and ice. Increasing wildfire introduces more light absorbing particles that multiply an existing heat-driven self-compounding melt feedback process. Yet, the relative importance of soot remains poorly understood.

Since 1994, I (Jason Box) have camped for more than 1 year on Greenland's inland ice and have more than 60 externally reviewed publications related to ice-climate interactions. A recent publication measures the feedback between heating of Greenland ice and its reflectivity. More heat reduces ice reflectivity through heat-driven ice crystal rounding. My study accurately predicted complete surface melting over Greenland that occurred in 2012. A missing piece of the science is gauging the relative importance of light absorbing impurities, especially black carbon "soot". I've assembled a team of scientists and communicators to bring this project to the people.

Dr. Thomas Painter is a Research Scientist in the Water and Carbon Cycles Group, in the Earth Sciences Section of NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, an Adjunct Professor of Geography at UCLA. His principle research interests lie in snow hydrology and water resources, energy balance of snow and ice, radiative forcing by light absorbing impurities in snow and ice, imaging spectroscopy and multispectral remote sensing, and planetary ices. Painter is Chairman and organizer of the Working Group on Light-Absorbing Impurities in Snow and Ice. He is also the Vice-Chair of the Cryosphere Focus Group of the American Geophysical Union.


Ms. McKenzie Skiles is a PhD student in the Geography department at UCLA, a graduate student researcher who manage the Snow Optics Laboratory. Skiles received her MS from the University of Utah in 2010, focusing on understanding how desert dust was impacting mountain snow cover in the Colorado River Basin. An avid backcountry skier originally from Anchorage, Alaska, her interest in snow is both personal and professional. Today, her main research interests include snow hydrology and radiative forcing by light absorbing impurities in snow and ice.

Dr Marek Stibal is a scientist in the Department of Geochemistry at the Geological Survey of Denmark and Greenland. He examines the microbial ecology and biogeochemistry of icy ecosystems, with an emphasis on large scale effects of microbial activity on glacial systems, carbon and nutrient cycling in the cryosphere, and microbial diversity, distribution and dispersal in Arctic and Antarctic terrestrial environments. He has been working on Arctic glaciers, including the Greenland Ice Sheet, since 2002.

Mr. Peter Sinclair is an independent, award winning, graphic artist, animator, and videographer now specializing in climate, energy, and related politics. He is arguably the internet's leading climate video blogger with 15 thousand subscribers to his video climate blog http://climatecrocks.com/. As of mid Nov., 2012, the Climate Crock series contains more than 100 videos and 9 in the Yale forum series, titled "This is Not Cool". Sinclair's most popular videos have gotten 80,000 views. The total viewership nears 2.5 million total views. Sinclair will join the expedition to shoot video and sound to produce video shorts to be posted online and pushed toward TV media. Here is an example of Peter's recent work.

Contributors own pieces science, our expedition and through continual video and social media reporting virtually join us on a Greenland expedition, beginning now with fundraising, during the expedition, and in a subsequent science digestion and production phase. Renowned video climate blogger Peter Sinclair plans several posts in addition to our debut video to help tell our story before, during and after the expedition.

What we need: field costs: aircraft charter (more than half of our cost), freight of science cargo, commercial air (flights), travel accomodations, and nourishment. Publication page charges. Video production supplies. We're not asking for salary.

Perks: At and above $25, supporters receive a high quality vinyl silk screened Dark Snow Project logo sticker. At and above $100 receive, in addition a high quality cap.  At and above $250 receive, in addition a high quality hoodie. At and above $1000, in addition receive Greenland-inspired sunglasses that also benefit a Greenland Children's home.

If we don't reach our funding goal, the funds will anway be used to support publication and video production costs as we will continue to communicate this emerging story.

The impact New thinking: each big science story deserves a communication front-end for public awareness building. The public are our market. Meanwhile, climate change is producing fast and surprising change that demands fast and flexible science response. Combining authentic field-based science with talented scientists and critically, clear factual communication are the keys to maximizing our impact.

Past success our team has successfully and safely executed dozens of field campaigns, has a collective 100 publications in top scientific journals, including Science, has been awarded past funding measured in millions of dollars. 

Other ways you can help Do you have marketing expertise, connections with industry sponsors? Can you help us get the word out by sharing this campaign with your personal netword? Indiegogo has a powerful set of share tools!

A recent publication measures the feedback between heating of Greenland ice and its reflectivity. More heat reduces ice reflectivity through heat-driven ice crystal rounding. My study accurately predicted complete surface melting over Greenland that occurred in 2012. A missing piece of the science is gauging the relative importance of light absorbing impurities, especially black carbon "soot". I've assembled a team of scientists and communicators to bring this project to the people.
Dr. Thomas Painter is a Research Scientist in the Water and Carbon Cycles Group, in the Earth Sciences Section of NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, an Adjunct Professor of Geography at UCLA. His principle research interests lie in snow hydrology and water resources, energy balance of snow and ice, radiative forcing by light absorbing impurities in snow and ice, imaging spectroscopy and multispectral remote sensing, and planetary ices. Painter is Chairman and organizer of the Working Group on Light-Absorbing Impurities in Snow and Ice. He is also the Vice-Chair of the Cryosphere Focus Group of the American Geophysical Union.
Ms. McKenzie Skiles is a PhD student in the Geography department at UCLA, a graduate student researcher who manage the Snow Optics Laboratory. Skiles received her MS from the University of Utah in 2010, focusing on understanding how desert dust was impacting mountain snow cover in the Colorado River Basin. An avid backcountry skier originally from Anchorage, Alaska, her interest in snow is both personal and professional. Today, her main research interests include snow hydrology and radiative forcing by light absorbing impurities in snow and ice.
Dr Marek Stibal is a scientist in the Department of Geochemistry at the Geological Survey of Denmark and Greenland. He examines the microbial ecology and biogeochemistry of icy ecosystems, with an emphasis on large scale effects of microbial activity on glacial systems, carbon and nutrient cycling in the cryosphere, and microbial diversity, distribution and dispersal in Arctic and Antarctic terrestrial environments. He has been working on Arctic glaciers, including the Greenland Ice Sheet, since 2002.

Mr. Peter Sinclair is an independent, award winning, graphic artist, animator, and videographer now specializing in climate, energy, and related politics. He is arguably the internet's leading climate video blogger with 15 thousand subscribers to his video climate blog http://climatecrocks.com/. As of mid Nov., 2012, the Climate Crock series contains more than 100 videos and 9 in the Yale forum series, titled "This is Not Cool". Sinclair's most popular videos have gotten 80,000 views. The total viewership nears 2.5 million total views. Sinclair will join the expedition to shoot video and sound to produce video shorts to be posted online and pushed toward TV media. Here is an example of Peter's recent work.
Contributors own pieces science, our expedition and through continual video and social media reporting virtually join us on a Greenland expedition, beginning now with fundraising, during the expedition, and in a subsequent science digestion and production phase. Renowned video climate blogger Peter Sinclair plans several posts in addition to our debut video to help tell our story before, during and after the expedition.
What we need: field costs: aircraft charter (more than half of our cost), freight of science cargo, commercial air (flights), travel accomodations, and nourishment. Publication page charges. Video production supplies. We're not asking for salary.
Perks: At and above $25, supporters receive a high quality vinyl silk screened Dark Snow Project logo sticker. At and above $100 receive, in addition a high quality cap.  At and above $250 receive, in addition a high quality hoodie. At and above $1000, in addition receive Greenland-inspired sunglasses that also benefit a Greenland Children's home.
If we don't reach our funding goal, the funds will anway be used to support publication and video production costs as we will continue to communicate this emerging story.
The impact New thinking: each big science story deserves a communication front-end for public awareness building. The public are our market. Meanwhile, climate change is producing fast and surprising change that demands fast and flexible science response. Combining authentic field-based science with talented scientists and critically, clear factual communication are the keys to maximizing our impact.
Past success our team has successfully and safely executed dozens of field campaigns, has a collective 100 publications in top scientific journals, including Science, has been awarded past funding measured in millions of dollars. 
Other ways you can help Do you have marketing expertise, connections with industry sponsors? Can you help us get the word out by sharing this campaign with your personal netword? Indiegogo has a powerful set of share tools!

story:
The stage is set to build a state-of-the-art Online Learning Center.  The support you provide will enable the OLC to host and offer an array of online classes, workshops, seminars, lectures, e-books, videos, continuing education courses surrounding most of our 39 healing categories.  Our goal is to provide these at modest prices offering a platform for healer/teacher and those seeking healing, information and inspiration.
Classes, Workshops, Webinars and Downloads in the following categories.
 
  • Acupuncture/TCM
  • Animals & Pets
  • Arts & Art Therapy
  • Aromatherapy
  • Astrology
  • Ayurveda
  • Books for Healing
  • Conscious Consumerism
  • Cosmology
  • Chiropractic
  • Dream Medicine
  • Eco-Products & Services
  • Energy Medicine
  • Exercise & Fitness
  • Family & Parenting
  • Film/Video
  • Healing Recipes
  • Herbalism
  • Holistic Nutrition
  • Homeopathy
  • Hypnotherapy
  • Integrative Medicine
  • Intuition & Symbols
  • Listen & Laugh (free)
  • Massage & Bodywork
  • Meditation
  • Music Therapy & Sound Healing
  • Naturopathy
  • Non Profs/Orgs
  • Organic Living
  • PsychoSpiritual
  • Psychotherapy
  • Sacred Living
  • Shamanism
  • Tarot
  • Therapeutic Storytelling
  • Think Green
  • Writing & Poetry Therapy
  • Yoga
Many of our editors and contributing writers have expressed a desire to teach and conduct classes from our website and are eager to get started. We will seek and solicit individuals, organizations, educational institutions and continuing education providers to place and list their classes & workshops in the OLC as well as create in-house productions, and fund others.
Here are some of the features of the ATH Online Learning Center:
  • Virtual Classroom for one time classes or workshop sessions
  • Pre-Recorded classes or Pre-Recorded workshop sessions
  • One on one video networking for personalized teacher/student interaction
  • Personalized student accounts to manage classes and site notifications
  • Continuing Education Friendly (CEU’s, CEC’s for online courses etc.)
  • Video, Audio & eBook capable
  • Forum for all Online Learning Center communications
  • Newsletter management to manage a series of various newsletter campaigns
  • Social Media friendly (FB, Twitter, AddThis etc)
  • Banner & Video Advertising
  • Comprehensive billing system – accept all types of payments including PayPal, Credit Card, E-Checks, etc.
  • Open Source platform to allow for easy updates, upgrades and plug-ins while keeping development costs minimal.
Who is AllThingsHealing.com?

The AllThingsHealing.com community consists of a small underpaid staff and over 70 volunteer editors, assistant editors, interns and guest editors (including Dr. Norm Shealy, Dr. Michael Murray, Lisa McCourt, Kathy Smith, Dr. Judith Orloff, to name a few) who are passionate about leaving the world in a better place than they found it.

The ATH Editors

We have created an alternative healing network of practitioners, educators, healers, therapists, creative artists, organizations and associations dedicated to educating and inspiring people in topics relating to alternative & holistic healing of mind, body, spirit and the planet. ATH has already published over 8,500 informative, entertaining and inspiring articles & videos spanning 39 healing categories, and an ever-growing Find Practitioners & Organizations directory and bookstore.

 
Having launched just over two years ago, AllThingsHealing.com  is growing rapidly receiving over 90,000 monthly visits resulting in 400,000+ pageviews along with over 6,000+ Facebook LIKES and 4,000+ on our mailing list.
We are continually solution oriented and emphasize wellcare and preventative philosophies & lifestyles as well as natural and holistic therapies.
The Online Learning Center will always be a work in progress with our sights set on quality and the eventual quantity over time. We realize it will take a degree of time to grow the content to a level of real choice and diversity for the rewards you select. Thus, you can claim your rewards over a three year period ending Jan 31st 2016.
We thank you for your help and participation and welcome you to the community!

story:
Short Summary

Greetings,

We are a group of ten students from Vergennes Union High School (VUHS) located in Vergennes, Vermont who will be traveling to the southern tip of Ghana for a service trip to the Trinity Yard School (TYS) in Cape Three Points, Ghana. This trip will take place from February 13-27, 2013. 

About Trinity Yard School

TYS was established in 2007 by Vermonter Rory Jackson and is a place students from local villages on Cape Three Points are able to obtain a secondary education.  This was an opportunity not available to them before this school was established. The TYS provides a fee-free secondary education with a focus on English, math, and a variety of vocational workshops.   Not only does TYS enrich the lives of their students and help them locate apprenticeships upon graducation, it also creates these enrichment opportunities for it’s Ghanaian staff and volunteers/students from abroad who participate in the school’s development.   For more on TYS, please visit http://www.trinityyardschool.org/

Student Exchange

Upon hearing about an opportunity to travel and donate time to TYS, we ten students from VUHS felt that this was an experience not to pass up and began working on a plan to make this goal a reality.  We will be working with TYS students on academic writing in English Composition.   We will design this writing course in collaboration with our English teachers and other staff to gather subject matter and resources to prepare and design our TYS project.  

In exchange, the students from TYS will offer us a course in arts-oriented trades such as Batik tie and dye and traditional Kente weaving.    We will also have opportunities to learn dance and drumming as well as participate in the daily chores of living in a place without electricity and machines.   As part of this trip we will also have the opportunity to visit the Akwidaa River, the Cape Three Points Forest Reserve, and Cape Coast to visit the slave forts.  

In addition to academics, we students have many other activities in our lives, such as sports and music, but we have made time together to formulate ideas on how to fundraise for this trip so that all ten of us can take part in this amazing opportunity.  So far we have hosted a public event for other students, held bake sales, sold flowers at local farmers markets and are selling firewood. 

Fundraising and What We Need

With our trip’s deadlines fast approaching, the reality of going on this trip is in jeopardy for some of us. This trip is very important to each of us and feel we can make a real contribution to the students in Ghana and well as gain experiences we could never dream of. 

The cost for each of us to take this trip is a total of $3,142.  This covers air fare, transportation in Ghana, excursions, staff, materials (water filters, mosquito netting, hygeine supplies), food, and an education fund donation to TYS.  We need to pay a total of $31,142 to make this trip a reality.   Raising money for this service trip will ensure  that all 10 of us can take this trip.   It will also give us a chance to take a journey that will change our perspectives for the rest of our lives.  

We are kindly asking for a donation so we can see our service project to TYS become a reality for each of us.  Your donation would be greatly appreciated by all parties involved!

If you are unable to make a contribution at this time PLEASE help us spread the word and share our story with your friends.

story:
SEEDS OF BLISS /גרעינים / بذر

“We all chew and spit the same. So for this one purpose we are just people chewing sunflower seeds.” Noam Edry, project leader.

A humorous Middle-Eastern response to Ai Weiwei's "Sunflower Seeds". People travel to neighbouring cities in the Middle-East to sit together for a few days and chew sunflower seeds, spitting the empty shells on the ground until they form a massive heap.

 

OUR PURPOSE…

In this project, Israeli interdisciplinary artist Noam Edry invites people from neighbouring cities in the Middle East to come together and chew a total of 10 tonnes of sunflower seeds. The shells are then collected to form an art installation and will be exhibited in London, along with a documentary film about the entire process and the people behind each and every shell.


SEEDS OF BLISS /גרעינים / بذر brings together individuals who would otherwise have little chance of meeting to share the simple pleasure of chewing sunflower seeds. Noam Edry plans 3-5 day long cracking adventures titled "Big Chews" in neighbouring cities where people sit together, eat sunflower seeds and socialize.

The paired neighbouring cities so far include:
– Aqaba (Jordan) and Eilat (Israel);
– Nablus (West Bank) and Haifa (Israel);
– Jenin (West Bank) and Afula (Israel).

 

OUR STORY SO FAR…

The project’s opening event, "The Big Chew", was held on 23 August 2012 at the artist's birthplace, Kibbutz Ramat Yohanan, in the North of Israel, where community members and residents of nearby Arab-Bedouin villages Khawaled and Ibtin as well as Shfaram and Zarzir chewed together the first few kilos of sunflower seeds. A tub full of shells was amassed. Later on there will be another "Big Chew" in the Village of Khawaled, in collaboration with the people of Kibbutz Ramat-Yohanan.

On the 9th September 2012 a team of Jewish and Arab Israelis travelled to Aqaba for 5 days to sit and chew sunflower seeds with the Jordanians at Al Firdous Café (Paradise Café) owned by Hasan Selmi in the city center. They brought with them 100 kilos of sunflower seeds, which they carried by hand in large sacs across the border. They cracked the seeds together with the Jordanians all over Aqaba; in restaurants and cafes, on the beach, in alleys, in private homes and even out at sea. Every evening from 9pm onwards there was a mass shelling of seeds at Al Firdous Café, where more than a hundred people sat together to crack sunflower seeds. The Jordanians gave the Israeli team a warm welcome and hosted them with open arms, inviting them into their homes and accompanying them throughout the five-day trip. Word of the "Big Chew" spread across the city and hundreds came to Al Firdous Café to take part, including the workers of the Mosque, the police force and the tax officers who helped to transfer the seeds across the border.

The members of the Jordanian team from Aqaba are currently awaiting their visa from the Israeli Consulate in Amman in order to be able to come for a 5-day visit to Eilat and to crack seeds with their new friends from Israel. The team will include approximately 10 people.


On 3 October 2012 a chewing team from Nablus came to the "Art and Street Culture" Festival in Haifa, to crack seeds with an estimated 100,000 visitors. Most of them had never visited Haifa before.

The Big Chews in Eilat and Nablus are planned to take place in November.

The Big Chews in Afula and Jenin will take place in December.

Some might say that it will take as long to reach 10 tonnes of shells, as to reach peace in the Middle East. But Noam Edry emphasizes that at the end of the day what counts is the “quality” not the “quantity” of the chewing. “The goal is to have a meaningful encounter and to develop a real friendship".

SEEDS OF BLISS /גרעינים / بذر project is in collaboration with the Haifa Museum of Art and Artis Contemporary. The seeds have been donated by Zarubi Seed Company, owned by Khalid Zarubi, with further contributions from Hazera, Migdan and many kibbutzim as well as private donors. The Haifa-Nablus Big Chews are partially sponsored by Haifa City Council and Nablus Governorate.

The project is documented by Shula Covo.

 

WITH YOUR SUPPORT…

In SEEDS OF BLISS /גרעינים / بذر everyone is a volunteer. With your help we can raise money for the transportation of the participants from city to city including housing and meals for the duration of each Big Chew.

The artist and her crew are documenting every stage of the process, and travel several times to each city on preparatory visits for each Big Chew.

We are also trying to raise money for the eventual transportation of the seeds to London. 


We wish to raise $15, 000 –

I. 4 additional planned Big Chews, each one costing an estimated $3000 (transportation + housing + meal to 10-15 people for 3-5 days)

II. Shipping the seeds to London – $3000

 

PRESS & MEDIA

http://www.haaretz.com/culture/arts-leisure/sowing-seeds-of-jewish-arab-coexistence-one-shell-at-a-time-1.455064

http://nocamels.com/2012/10/how-chewing-10-tons-of-sunflowers-seeds-brings-arabs-and-israelis-together/

http://www.midnighteast.com/mag/?p=20834

http://contemporarytalks.com/?p=2614

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1pTs2rQYGzw&feature=youtu.be

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2n0I0Ljuspg&list=UUew-LhiOIdDBiwKOGJAv0VA&feature=player_embedded

 

Feel free to contact us on facebook: facebook.com/bizer2012

 

Help this project to grow!

        THANK YOU!

II. Shipping the seeds to London – $3000

http://nocamels.com/2012/10/how-chewing-10-tons-of-sunflowers-seeds-brings-arabs-and-israelis-together/

http://contemporarytalks.com/?p=2614

        THANK YOU!

story:
We are AHA! the most innovative and inspiring non profit working to empower teens to be highly compassionate, creative, and emotionally intelligent adults.  We have been serving over 10,000 teens since 1999 in Santa Barbara.  

We now know that the most important thing to do is to make campuses safe places for everyone to learn and THRIVE.

Our workshop is for students and teachers to learn together how to listen deeply to each other and how to interrupt hatred and bullying when they see it.

This is a pilot project which could then lead to workshops all over the state and it would ultimately be a way for schools to change their cultures without cost by making sure all teachers and students have these peace building skills.

The money we get will be used entirely to give  students stipends to attend these trainings so that students have great incentive and college credits for becoming peace builders, and staff are compensated for this summer training.

The perk you will all receive for funding this is a short film we will create on this training so you will see your dollars at work, changing the world for the better.

All funds will be used for this training regardless of the goal we reach.

 

Right NOW AHA! is helping reduce suspensions by up to 75% and helping after school youth solve real life problems .  You can be part of our movement to change schools from emotional battlegrounds to institutions of higher caring.

 

We implore you to be part of our team of peace builders by supporting our efforts here and through our website too.

 

You are the reason we can do more than we could imagine, and achieve more than anyone dared to believe.

Our workshop is for students and teachers to learn together how to listen deeply to each other and how to interrupt hatred and bullying when they see it.
This is a pilot project which could then lead to workshops all over the state and it would ultimately be a way for schools to change their cultures without cost by making sure all teachers and students have these peace building skills.


The money we get will be used entirely to give  students stipends to attend these trainings so that students have great incentive and college credits for becoming peace builders, and staff are compensated for this summer training.
The perk you will all receive for funding this is a short film we will create on this training so you will see your dollars at work, changing the world for the better.
All funds will be used for this training regardless of the goal we reach.
 


Right NOW AHA! is helping reduce suspensions by up to 75% and helping after school youth solve real life problems .  You can be part of our movement to change schools from emotional battlegrounds to institutions of higher caring.
 
We implore you to be part of our team of peace builders by supporting our efforts here and through our website too.
 
You are the reason we can do more than we could imagine, and achieve more than anyone dared to believe.

story:
I am the head Coach of the Lady Tigers, a girls softball team located in the South Bronx, NY.  Plagued by an environment riddled with poverty and gang violence, our girls have overcome great obstacles, remained determined and dedicated to the game of softball.  They have had a tough season but despite their losses, our Lady Tigers NEVER gave up.  To smile in the face of defeat takes great courage and is a characteristic of a true champion.  In my eyes, my girls deserve to be recognized for their accomplishments.

Therefore, I would like to hold an awards ceremony where trophies will be given to the Lady Tigers in the presence of family, friends, and teachers.

Please join me in celebrating the accomplishments of the Lady Tigers.

Coach Astacio
